Class TableHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • tablr.TableHandler

  • public class TableHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsibility:
    provide a controller for the table mode and its use cases.
    Invariant:
    the handler always has a TableManager.
        getTableManager() != null

      • canHaveAsName

        public boolean canHaveAsName(java.lang.String tableName,
                             java.lang.String newTableName)
                      throws IllegalTableException
        Returns whether the table with tableName can have the newTableName name.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to check on.
        newTableName - the name you want to check on.
        Returns:
        true if the table with tableName exist, no other table has that name and the name is valid.
            if(tableName in getTableNames()) {result == (tableName == newTableName
            || (newTableName not in getTableName() && Table.isValidName(newTableName)))}
        Throws:
        IllegalTableException - if the table with that tableName does not exist. | âˆ€strings in getTableNames(): strings != tableName

      • setTableName

        public void setTableName(java.lang.String tableName,
                         java.lang.String newName)
                  throws IllegalTableException,
                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the tablename of the table with tableName to newName if there is such a table and newname is valid.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table whos name is to be changed.
        newName - the new name of the table.
        Effect:
        if both names are valid, the table with tableName now has newName as name.
            if(hasAsTable(tableName) && canHaveAsName(tableName, newName){
              old.getTable(tableName) == new.getTable(newName)
            }
        Throws:
        IllegalTableException - if there is no table with tableName. | !getTableManager().hasAsTable(tableName)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the new name is not valid for the given table. | !getTableMangaer().canHaveAsName(tableName, newName)

      • addTable

        public void addTable()
        Adds a new table with no columns and rows and name TableN, with N the smallest strictly positive integer such that there is no other table with name TableN.
        Effect:
        there is now a new table.
            old.getNbTables() + 1 == new.getNbTables()

      • removeTable

        public void removeTable(java.lang.String tableName)
                 throws IllegalTableException
        Removes the table with the given name, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to be removed.
        Effect:
        if a table exists with the given name, the table is removed.
            if(old.getTableNames.contains(tableName)){
               new.getTableNames.contains(tableName == false &&
               old.getNbTables() + 1 == new.getNbTables()
            }
        Throws:
        IllegalTableException - If the there is no table with tablename. | !getTableNames().contains(tableName)

      • openTable

        public void openTable(java.lang.String tableName)
               throws IllegalTableException
        Sets the open table to tableName if the table exists.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to be opened.
        Effect:
        if the table exists, the open table will be the table.
            if(getTableNames().contains(tableName)){getOpenTable() == tableName}
        Throws:
        IllegalTableException - if there is no table with tableName. | !getTableNames().contains(tableName)
